did.abstract: The Berkshire Forum was founded in 1973 in Stephentown, New York, as a forum for discussion of social and political issues. The Forum was located on land owned by Herman Liveright and Betty Liveright, who headed the Forum until 1989. The Forum appears to have ceased to exist by 1991. The founders and most guests were independent Old Leftists. The collection contains files on the numerous workshops and other programs held at the Forum, files on tours sponsored by the Forum, and administrative files, including board minutes. bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Berkshire Forum was founded in 1973 in Stephentown, New York, as a forum for discussion of social and political issues. The Forum was located on land owned by Herman Liveright (1912-2001), son of Horace Liveright (founder of the publishing firm Boni and Liveright, known for its publication of controversial works), and his wife Betty Liveright, who headed the Forum until 1989. The Forum appears to have ceased to exist by 1991. The founders and most guests were independent Old Leftists, although a minority was of the New Left generation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: INVENTORY AVAILABLE AT REPOSITORY. CONTACT: peter.filardo@nyu.edu

The collection contains files on the numerous workshops and other programs held at the Forum, whose topics included United States political and social problems, international affairs, peace movements, the Communist countries, and a radical writers retreat, files on tours sponsored by the Forum, including trips to Cuba, the German Democratic Republic, Nicaragua, and the Soviet Union, and administrative files, including board minutes.
